subject: RE: [junit] Query about passing parameters from @Suite to Junit file
msgSnippet: Could you use System Properties? You can pass the values on the command line (-Dkey1=value1 -Dkey2=value2) Scott ________________________________ From:
messageBody:
Could you use System Properties? You can pass the values on the command
line (-Dkey1=value1 -Dkey2=value2)



Scott



________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Deepankar
Sent: Friday, November 28, 2008 3:41 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Query about passing parameters from @Suite to Junit
file



Hi,

I have a small issue. I am using Junit 4 and trying to call a junit file
from test Suite.

*The Suite file* is as follows:-

*import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.junit.runners.Suite;

@RunWith(Suite.class)
@...( {EmployeeTest.class})
public class EmployeeTestAMAllTests {
}*

*Junit Test Class*

*import org.junit.After;
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.Test;

public class EmployeeTest {

public EmployeeTest(String AM_NAME, String VO_NAME) { //How
to pass them from the test suite?
super(AM_NAME, VO_NAME);
}

@Before
public void setUp() throws Exception {
setUpBefore();
}
@Test
public void createRecord() {
testCreateRecord();
}

@After
public void tearDown() throws Exception {
tearDownAfter();
}*

The issue I am facing is that I need to pass parameters from the Test
Suite
to the Junit Test Class file for the instantiation of the file. Can
anyone
please help me in this as it is very urgent.

Thanks In advance :-)

Regards,
Deepankar
